intro: Sciadiara cneorum, commonly known as the common cneorum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant has opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves that are usually aromatic. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Sciadiara cneorum is often used in ornamental gardening for its delicate appearance and fragrant blooms.
